intro: Bartsia nyikensis, commonly known as the Nyikénsis bartsia, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Orobanchaceae. It is native to the highland regions of East Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is a hemiparasitic species, meaning it derives some of its nutrients from the roots of other plants. Bartsia nyikensis thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
